summary: Services Marketplace feature testing complete. All 19 backend API tests passed (100%). Frontend UI verified with all major components working. Minor fix applied: Added 'Services' link to main navbar.

features_verified.details: Returns 10 service categories with correct structure
Returns Senegal cities and Dakar zones
Returns providers list with filtering support
Returns provider details without password (SECURITY VERIFIED)
Registers providers with valid invitation code, rejects invalid codes
Lists all providers with stats (requires admin auth)
Lists all service requests with stats
Updates service request status and assignment
All provider APIs exclude password field from responses
Loads with categories, providers, search, filters
Displays name, profession, location, price, contact buttons
Shows full provider details with reviews section
Form with all required fields working
Lists service requests with status management
Added Services link to main navbar (was missing)

password_exclusion.GET /api/admin/service-providers: PASS - No password in admin list

security_verification.admin_auth_required: PASS - Admin endpoints return 401 without auth

critical_code_review_comments: Security properly implemented - passwords excluded from all API responses using MongoDB projection
Invitation code system working correctly for private provider registration
Admin approval workflow implemented - new providers require activation
All 10 service categories properly defined with French translations
Provider filtering by category, city, zone, verified status working
seed_data_creation: Test provider (Mamadou Ndiaye - Plombier) and test service request already exist in database
context_for_next_testing_agent: Services Marketplace feature fully tested and working. All APIs return correct data. Security verified - no passwords exposed. Admin dashboard has 'Prestataires' and 'Demandes Services' menu items. Provider registration requires invitation code (YAMAPLUS2025, PRESTATAIRE, or SERVICEPRO). New providers require admin approval before becoming visible.
